abstracts.cdata!:
The basic objective of the Agricultural
            Services Rehabilitation Credit Project is to initiate a
            self-sustaining process of rehabilitation so that the
            Ministry of Agriculture (MOA) can give more effective
            support to agriculture.  Specifically, it has two
            interrelated objectives:  strengthening the institutional
            framework for the formulation and implementation of
            agricultural policies and programs; and improving the
            delivery of public sector services to agriculture.  To this
            end, the project includes:  (a) the reorganization and
            strengthening of MOA's work in policy formulation,
            planning, monitoring and evaluation; (b) the preparation of
            a national master plan for research and funding of research
            on cotton and rice; and (c) the reorganization of MOA's
            agricultural extension services in 3 regions on a pilot
            basis.  In addition, the project entails (d) the
            strengthening of the Ghana Irrigation Development Authority;
            (e) logistical support for veterinary services; and (f)
            studies of the agricultural credit system and food security.
            Lastly, it includes a program for sector management.
